intro: Hieracium revolii, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal rosettes of leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, and it thrives in rocky or alpine soils. Hieracium revolii is often found in open, sunny habitats at high altitudes.
